result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelvin D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid with in 1 year of release from current sentence.
11/08/18 COURT WAIVES COURT COSTS OF $253.00. DNA SURCHARGE REMAINS.

Huber with release for work search, work, and AODA treatment/counseling. Court orders that sentence be served at Waukesha County Huber. Court also waives 1/2 of Huber fees.
11/08/18 COURT AMENDS SENTENCE TO STATE HUBER FEES ARE NOT WAIVED. MILWAUKEE SENTENCE WILL BE SERVED IN MILWAUKEE UNLESS WAUKESHA ACCEPTS AUTHORITY.
Concurrent with: Other sentence

Case 17CM762 was dismissed and read into this matter.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on:  10/24/18
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2018 at 10:30 am.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee House of Corrections.

Defendant Kelvin D Davis in court by video, in custody at MHOC, with attorney Paul Crawford for attorney Katie B. Kegel.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Crawford advises the court of the status of the case and is still awaiting on a gobal offer.  Atty. Crawford is asking the matter be adjourned for further proceedings.  Defendant presents statements.  Under the circumstances court asks if the matter should be set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Crawford is in agreement.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing as soon as possible.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Corrections for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on October 17, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Kyle Jesinski for attorney Katie B. Kegel in court.   Defendant Kelvin D Davis did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes it attempted to contact the defendant by video from MHOC.  Court makes a record of what occured when the court contacted MHOC to see why the defendant was not available for the video conference.  Court was informed that they did not have confirmation of the video conference, even thought the clerk does, and due to the video unit being used for other cases they were not able to accomodate the court.  Based on that information the Court will allow a short adjournment to set up a new video appearance for the defendant from MHOC.  Court will have the clerk as well as Atty. Kegel call MHOC to confirm the defendant will be available at the next date and time.  Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 27, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 7, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with W. Steel and Grinding Company/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
